issue.title: e.mail.ru
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

5.1.102

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://e.mail.ru/messages/inbox?octavius=off

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Popups filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Block WebRTC, Hide Referrer from third-parties (specify in comment below, if used custom value)

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. При нажатии "Очистить" рядом со "Спамом" или "Корзиной", в старой версии почты, должно появляться всплывающее окошко с подтверждением действия, но вместо этого скрывается один из основных, несущих элементов, в результате чего страница становится пуста.

 Причиной тому является правило `e.mail.ru#?#.balloon:upward(1)` в "Фильтре всплывающих окон".

2. <details><summary>Screenshot:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b1ce02e-e3c3-4942-ae92-714d8a5f7907)
</details>

issue.title: Fix #208352 parked domain in AdGuard tracking protection filters list

comment.body:
I think that the problem is that `||parklogic.com^$third-party` has been removed (https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/208559/files#diff-006601d92e65b582e58605bcd049981c38dc4b10b2a603ce24ccaa359fb60ce3L3101) but probably should not be.
As far as I understand, it's used on parked domains for tracking purpose.
I will revert this rule.

comment.body:
It's caused by `Hungarian` filter. You can add these rules temporary or disable the filter until it's fixed by its author. Next time, please report it to its repo.
```adblock
||*.hu/*wp-content/plugins/complianz-gdpr/*.js$script,badfilter
||*.hu/*wp-content/plugins/complianz-gdpr/*.css$stylesheet,badfilter
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E5%8F%B2%E8%AB%BE%E7%99%BB+ithome&newwindow=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3D%25E5%258F%25B2%25E8%25AB%25BE%25E7%2599%25BB%2Bithome%26newwindow%3D1) ### Comment > AdGuard is unable to correctly handle Percent-Encoding (e.g., `%=` = `%25`, `&` = `%26`) under certain circumstances. > This issue arises when processing specific URLs or URLs that contain Chinese characters. > > For example, try searching for **"伺服器 ithome"** on `www.google.com`. > When opening the ithome website from the search results, the address cannot be entered properly. > > **Example URL:** > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1) > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1) > > By disabling protection for `www.google.com` via the **AdGuard browser extension** on **MS Edge**, the issue can be quickly resolved. > However, since I am using **AdGuard for Windows**, the problem may be related to features such as traffic filtering or HTTPS filtering. > ### Screenshots

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/207789#issuecomment-3019545689
In apps and MV2 extension it should be already fixed.
Please update filters.

<hr>

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/207789#issuecomment-3019827474
>When I activate the filtering rules, clicking the button in the red frame has no response. (There is no such problem after closing AdGuard.)

Unfortunately the problem may still occurs in MV3. Due to Google policy MV3 extension cannot update filters. So new rules will be available in one of the next extension updates.
Until then, please add following rules to user rules:

```adblock
bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', '__MIRROR_REPORT__', 'emptyObj')
bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', '__MIRROR_REPORT__.techReportPb', 'noopFunc')
bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', '__MIRROR_REPORT__.customReportPb', 'noopFunc')
bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', '__MIRROR_REPORT__.customPerformanceQuota', 'noopFunc')
```

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
The issue with ads in the Brave browser should be resolved in AdGuard Extra `1.0.699`, but only in the userscript.
To fix it in the extension, an additional permission would need to be added. The problem is that when a new permission is added, the extension is automatically disabled. To enable it, the user must accept the new permission.

Considering that this is only required for one browser, and that it has been necessary to update the solution a few times within a short period, it was decided to not fix it in the extension for now.
This decision may be reconsidered later.

Instruction on how to install the userscript can be found here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra?tab=readme-ov-file#userscript

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E5%8F%B2%E8%AB%BE%E7%99%BB+ithome&newwindow=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3D%25E5%258F%25B2%25E8%25AB%25BE%25E7%2599%25BB%2Bithome%26newwindow%3D1) ### Comment > AdGuard is unable to correctly handle Percent-Encoding (e.g., `%=` = `%25`, `&` = `%26`) under certain circumstances. > This issue arises when processing specific URLs or URLs that contain Chinese characters. > > For example, try searching for **"伺服器 ithome"** on `www.google.com`. > When opening the ithome website from the search results, the address cannot be entered properly. > > **Example URL:** > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1) > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1) > > By disabling protection for `www.google.com` via the **AdGuard browser extension** on **MS Edge**, the issue can be quickly resolved. > However, since I am using **AdGuard for Windows**, the problem may be related to features such as traffic filtering or HTTPS filtering. > ### Screenshots

Z tego co widzę, to w przeszłości był problem z działaniem aplikacji `Player` - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/issues/3646 i prawdopodobnie teraz domyślnie filitrowanie jest wyłączone.
Obecnie widzę, że problem z nieprawidłowym działaniem nie występuje.

W ustawieniach AdGuarda spróbuj proszę znaleźć aplikację `Player` i włącz proszę filtrowanie dla tej aplikacji.
To powinno rozwiązać problem z reklamami.
